result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie Douglas McMillan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Restition is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Elma M., without prior court approval.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Charlie Douglas McMillan
Current: 3232 W Silver Spring Dr Apt 105, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 10-09-2017)
Prior: 5634 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Charlie Douglas McMillan in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Charlie Douglas McMillan in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #2 and #3), in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #1 and #3), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to counts #1 and #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
    --- as to count #1. 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Elma M., 
   without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
    --- cash bail to apply.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not filed by defense counsel).
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Charles Douglas McMillan in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State was prepared to proceed to trial on case 2015CM877.  Defendant to enter a plea on case 2015CM877.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion fo the State, Court ordered COUNT #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1, #2, and #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Charles Douglas McMillan in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All the discovery has been turned over to defense counsel, including a global offer.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CM4264, 2015CM463 and 2015CM877.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including gps supervision, no contact with Elma M., or her address.  Per letter in file, dated 4-16-2015, Court would amend the no contact order only for the purposes of the defendant and victim to go to bank escorted by Milwaukee Police Officer, Gary Sherone from District 5, to resolve an issue that requires both signatures by parties to cash a check.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ELMA M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charlie Douglas McMillan in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Charlie Douglas McMillan in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge FLANAGAN.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
